nameOverride.description: If provided, overrides the release name, for example, in the app.kubernetes.io/name label

fullnameOverride.description: If provided, overrides the release name, for example, in the naming of resources (pods, deployments, etc.)

imagePullSecrets.description:
If provided, this will be configured as an imagePullSecrets value for pulling images directly included in this chart (the MongoDB(®) sub-chart has its own imagePullSecrets configuration). The array is a list of Kubernetes secrets, likely of type `kubernetes.io/dockerconfigjson`. Example:
imagePullSecrets: docker-secret

shipaRepositoryDirname.description: The base directory for Shipa Corp images. For Shipa Corp images this value has repositoryBasename and tag appended to it to determine the location to pull images from. This does not affect non-Shipa Corp images, such as k8s.gcr.io/ingress-nginx/controller, docker.io/postgres, k8s.gcr.io/mongodb-install, docker.io/mongo, and docker.io/busybox

enabled.description: If enabled, a Shipa specific ServiceAccount will be used by resources, otherwise `"default"` is used

adminUser.description: is the login name for the initial admin

adminPassword.description: is the password for the initial admin

port.description: Port to expose for HTTP traffic to the Shipa API pod

securePort.description: Port to expose for HTTPS traffic to the Shipa API pod

servicePorts.description: Ports to expose for HTTP traffic to the Shipa API Service

serviceSecurePorts.description: Ports to expose for HTTPS traffic to the Shipa API Service

repositoryBasename.description: The repository name to use for pulling the Shipa API image

tag.description: The tag to use for pulling the Shipa API image

pullPolicy.description: Image pull policy to use for pulling the Shipa API image

debug.description: Enables debug log level for the Shipa API

resources.description:
Can be used to put resource limits on the Shipa API pod. Example:
shipaApi:
  resources:
    requests:
      memory: 16Mi
      cpu: 50m
    limits:
      memory: 64Mi
      cpu: 250m

cnames.description:
If there are any DNS names that will be used they need to be specified here for appropriate ingress and cert provisioning. Example:
shipaApi:
  cnames:
    - target.myshipa.lan
    - other-target.myshipa.lan

allowRestartIngressControllers.description: If set to false, disables the ability for a cluster update to restart the ingress controllers

isCAEndpointDisabled.description: If set to true, the ca/certificates endpoint of the Shipa API will be disabled, which disallows the Shipa CLI from trusting invalid TLS certificates when connecting to this Shipa API

secureIngressOnly.description: If set to true, all HTTP traffic to the Shipa API ingress will be redirected to HTTPS

useInternalHost.description: If true (recommended), the main shipa cluster will communicate with the Shipa API using the internal Kubernetes host name, rather than an external CNAME

customSecretName.description: If provided, this secret will be used as the TLS secret for the API ingress controller. Use this if you have a trusted certificate that you wish to use instead of the default, self-signed certificate

customIngressAnnotations.description:
If provided, these annotations will be added to the Shipa API Ingress resources. Example:
shipaApi
  customIngressAnnotations:
    custom-keys/first-key: "bbb"
    custom-keys/second-key: "ddd"

id.description: If provided, we assume that old database should be loaded and this refers to old main organization id

clusterDomain.description: The domain that your cluster uses internally, through coredns, kube-dns, etc.

enablePostUpgradeHookForRootClusterUpdat.description: Flag that identifies whether it should execute helm chart post-upgrade hook to update root cluster packages

type.description: ingress controller type. Supported values: (nginx, istio, traefik)

image.description: NGINX ingress controller image. If the ingress controller type is nginx and no ingress controller ip address is provided, an ingress controller will be deployed using this image

serviceType.description: ingress controller serviceType. When using shipa managed nginx, we reconcile looking for the right Host of LoadBalancer or ClusterIP based on what is provided here. When using non user managed ingress controller we use this just to store it in DB

ip.description: Ingress controller ip address. If provided, we assume user provided ingress controller should be used and create api resources for it

className.description: Ingress controller class name. If undefined, in most places we set default: nginx, traefik, istio. If we detect that it's shipa managed nginx, we default to shipa-nginx-ingress

apiAccessOnIngressIp.description:
If enabled, we will create ingress controller resources to allow api to be accessible on root ip of ingress controller.
NOTE: all ingresses require Host targeting instead of Path targeting for TLS. Also if you use nginxinc/kubernetes-ingress, using Ingress without host is not allowed until this is resolved: https://github.com/nginxinc/kubernetes-ingress/issues/209

clusterIp.description: Ingress controller ClusterIp address. If provided, it will be used for shipa managed nginx ingress controller

loadBalancerIp.description: Ingress controller LoadBalancerIp address. If provided, it will be used for shipa managed nginx ingress controller

nodePort.description: If provided, it will be used as node port for shipa managed nginx ingress controller

customNginxServiceAnnotations.description: If provided, these annotations will be appended to the Shipa managed Nginx ingress controller Service resource. Example for configuring internet facing NLB in AWS:

config.description:
Configuration overrides for the Shipa managed Nginx ingress controller. Example (these are the defaults if you leave this empty):
shipaCluster:
  ingress:
    config:
      proxy-body-size: "512M"
      proxy-read-timeout: "300"
      proxy-connect-timeout: "300"
      proxy-send-timeout: "300"
      upstream-keepalive-timeout: "300"

host.description: Host to connect to for Clair database. Leave blank to default to {{ template "shipa.fullname" . }}-postgres.{{ .Release.Namespace }}

port.description: Port to connect to for Clair database

user.description: User to connect to for Clair database

password.description: Password to connect to for Clair database. Leave blank to generate a random value

sslmode.description: The SSL mode to run PostgreSQL in. Options: "require", "verify-full", "verify-ca", or "disable

create.description: Set to false to avoid creating a PostgreSQL instance, for example, if you are using an external PostgreSQL instance

image.description: If postgres.create is set to true, this is the image that will be used

storageClass.description: The storageClassName to use. Undefined or null will use the default provisioner, or "-" will to set storageClassName to "", disabling dynamic provisioning

accessMode.description: The PVC access mode to use. Options: ReadWriteOnce, ReadOnlyMany or ReadWriteMany

size.description: The amount of storage to provision for the Clair database

installUrl.description: When Shipa is installed, if cert-manager is not yet installed (existence of cert-manager ClusterIssuer CRD) it will be installed via the resources at the provided URL

enabled.description: If set to false, the Shipa Dashboard will not be deployed

repositoryBasename.description: The repository name to use for pulling the dashboard image

tag.description: The tag to use for pulling the dashboard image

repositoryBasename.description: The repository name to use for pulling the Shipa CLI image

tag.description: The tag to use for pulling the Shipa CLI image

pullPolicy.description: Image pull policy to use for pulling the Shipa CLI image

repositoryBasename.description: The repository name to use for pulling the metrics image

tag.description: The tag to use for pulling the metrics image

pullPolicy.description: Image pull policy to use for pulling the metrics image

password.description: Password to setup for connecting to the Shipa metrics. If left blank, a random value will be generated and used

prometheusArgs.description: Arguments to pass to Prometheus on starting the Shipa metrics

extraPrometheusConfiguration.description:
Extra configuration to add to `prometheus.yaml`. Example for configuring remote reads and writes:
metrics:
  extraPrometheusConfiguration: \|
    remote_read:
      - url: http://localhost:9268/read
    remote_write:
      - url: http://localhost:9268/write

repositoryBasename.description: The repository name to use for pulling the busybody image

tag.description: The tag to use for pulling the busybody image

repositoryBasename.description: The repository name to use for pulling the Shipa controller image

tag.description: The tag to use for pulling the Shipa controller image

enableEventUpdater.description: Shipa creates and shows more shipa events for discovered applications

repositoryBasename.description: The repository name to use for pulling the Prometheus exporter image

tag.description: The tag to use for pulling the Prometheus exporter image

repositoryBasename.description: The repository name to use for pulling the Clair image

tag.description: The tag to use for pulling the Clair image

repositoryBasename.description: The repository name to use for pulling the Ketch controller image

tag.description: The tag to use for pulling the Ketch controller image

metricsAddress.description: Address of where metrics will be sent. Leave empty to disable metrics for Ketch

repositoryBasename.description: The repository name to use for pulling the Shipa agent image

tag.description: The tag to use for pulling the Shipa agent image

url.description: Connection URL for external MongoDB instance.

username.description: Username for authenticating to an external MongoDB instance

password.description: Password for authenticating to an external MongoDB instance

enable.description: Set to false to disable TLS when connecting to external DB instance.

defaultDB.description: Set defaultDB (and legacyMongoReplicaset) to `false` when using external DB to not install default DB. It will also prevent creating Persistent Volumes. This cannot be used with tags.legacyMongoReplicaset

legacyMongoReplicaset.description: (Deprecated) Set legacyMongoReplicaset to 'true' in order to use the deprecated https://charts.helm.sh/stable/mongodb-replicaset chart as an internal MongoDB. This cannot be used with tags.defaultDB

imageRegistry.description: Global Docker image registry for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

imagePullSecrets.description: Global Docker registry secret names as an array

registry.description: MongoDB(®) image registry for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

repository.description: MongoDB(®) image registry for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

tag.description: MongoDB(®) image tag (immutable tags are recommended) for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

pullPolicy.description: MongoDB(®) image pull policy for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

pullSecrets.description: Specify docker-registry secret names as an array for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

existingClaim.description: Provide an existing `PersistentVolumeClaim` (only when `architecture=standalone`) for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

size.description: PVC Storage Request for MongoDB(®) data volume for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

architecture.description: MongoDB(®) architecture (`standalone` or `replicaset`) for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

useStatefulSet.description: Set to true to use a StatefulSet instead of a Deployment (only when `architecture=standalone`) for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

replicaSetName.description: Name of the replica set (only when `architecture=replicaset`) for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

port.description: MongoDB(®) service port for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

enabled.description: Enable Arbiter pod(s)' Security Context for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

fsGroup.description: Group ID for the volumes of the Arbiter pod(s) for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

enabled.description: Enable Arbiter container(s)' Security Context for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

runAsUser.description: User ID for the Arbiter container for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

enabled.description: Enable authentication for MongoDB(®) dependent chart
Enable MongoDB(®) TLS support between nodes in the cluster as well as between mongo clients and nodes for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

registry.description: Init container TLS certs setup image registry for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

repository.description: Init container TLS certs setup image repository for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

tag.description: Init container TLS certs setup image tag (immutable tags are recommended) for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

pullPolicy.description: Init container TLS certs setup image pull policy for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

pullSecrets.description: Init container TLS certs specify docker-registry secret names as an array for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

enabled.description: Enable Kubernetes external cluster access to MongoDB(®) nodes (only for replicaset architecture) for MongoDB(®) dependent chart
Enable using an init container to auto-detect external IPs by querying the K8s API for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

registry.description: Init container auto-discovery image registry for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

repository.description: Init container auto-discovery image repository for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

tag.description: Init container auto-discovery image tag (immutable tags are recommended) for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

pullPolicy.description: Init container auto-discovery image pull policy for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

pullSecrets.description: Init container auto-discovery image pull secrets for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

enabled.description: Enable init container that changes the owner and group of the persistent volume(s) mountpoint to `runAsUser:fsGroup` for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

registry.description: Init container volume-permissions image registry for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

repository.description: Init container volume-permissions image repository for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

tag.description: Init container volume-permissions image tag (immutable tags are recommended) for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

pullPolicy.description: Init container volume-permissions image pull policy for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

pullSecrets.description: Specify docker-registry secret names as an array for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

enabled.description: Enable using a sidecar Prometheus exporter for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

registry.description: MongoDB(®) Prometheus exporter image registry for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

repository.description: MongoDB(®) Prometheus exporter image repository for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

tag.description: MongoDB(®) Prometheus exporter image tag (immutable tags are recommended) for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

pullPolicy.description: MongoDB(®) Prometheus exporter image pull policy for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

pullSecrets.description: Specify docker-registry secret names as an array for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

extraFlags.description: MongoDB(®) additional command line flags for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

enabled.description: Enable MongoDB(®) container(s)' Security Context for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

runAsUser.description: User ID for the MongoDB(®) container for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

runAsNonRoot.description: Set MongoDB(®) container's Security Context runAsNonRoot for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

enabled.description: Enable MongoDB(®) pod(s)' Security Context for MongoDB(®) dependent chart

fsGroup.description: Group ID for the volumes of the MongoDB(®) pod(s) for MongoDB(®) dependent chart
